channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: LCE -- An Augmented Combination of Bagging and Boosting in Python
item.description: lcensemble is a high-performing, scalable and user-friendly Python package for the general tasks of classification and regression.

item.title: Semantic-aware Network for Aerial-to-Ground Image Synthesis
item.description: Aerial-to-ground image synthesis is an emerging and challenging problem that aims to synthesize a ground image from an aerial image.

item.title: Platypus: Quick, Cheap, and Powerful Refinement of LLMs
item.description: We present $\textbf{Platypus}$, a family of fine-tuned and merged Large Language Models (LLMs) that achieves the strongest performance and currently stands at first place in HuggingFace's Open LLM Leaderboard as of the release date of this work.

item.title: Color-NeuS: Reconstructing Neural Implicit Surfaces with Color
item.description: Mesh is extracted from the signed distance function (SDF) network for the surface, and color for each surface vertex is drawn from the global color network.

item.title: EasyEdit: An Easy-to-use Knowledge Editing Framework for Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) usually suffer from knowledge cutoff or fallacy issues, which means they are unaware of unseen events or generate text with incorrect facts owing to the outdated/noisy data.

item.title: Knowing Where to Focus: Event-aware Transformer for Video Grounding
item.description: Recent DETR-based video grounding models have made the model directly predict moment timestamps without any hand-crafted components, such as a pre-defined proposal or non-maximum suppression, by learning moment queries.

item.title: Contrastive Bi-Projector for Unsupervised Domain Adaption
item.description: The GS scheme can be exploited to tackle the unstable problem of the CD loss because training the CBPUDA requires using contrastive learning and adversarial learning at the same time.

item.title: MixBCT: Towards Self-Adapting Backward-Compatible Training
item.description: As a solution, backward-compatible training can be employed to avoid the necessity of updating old retrieval datasets.

item.title: Temporal Sentence Grounding in Streaming Videos
item.description: The goal of TSGSV is to evaluate the relevance between a video stream and a given sentence query.

item.title: Global Features are All You Need for Image Retrieval and Reranking
item.description: We, for the first time, propose an image retrieval paradigm leveraging global feature only to enable accurate and lightweight image retrieval for both coarse retrieval and reranking, thus the name - SuperGlobal.

item.title: Aesthetics of Sanskrit Poetry from the Perspective of Computational Linguistics: A Case Study Analysis on Siksastaka
item.description: We provide a deep analysis of Siksastaka, a Sanskrit poem, from the perspective of 6 prominent kavyashastra schools, to illustrate the proposed framework.

item.title: A One Stop 3D Target Reconstruction and multilevel Segmentation Method
item.description: We extend object tracking and 3D reconstruction algorithms to support continuous segmentation labels to leverage the advances in the 2D image segmentation, especially the Segment-Anything Model (SAM) which uses the pretrained neural network without additional training for new scenes, for 3D object segmentation.

item.title: Group Pose: A Simple Baseline for End-to-End Multi-person Pose Estimation
item.description: State-of-the-art solutions adopt the DETR-like framework, and mainly develop the complex decoder, e. g., regarding pose estimation as keypoint box detection and combining with human detection in ED-Pose, hierarchically predicting with pose decoder and joint (keypoint) decoder in PETR.

item.title: Distance Matters For Improving Performance Estimation Under Covariate Shift
item.description: In this work, we show that taking into account distances of test samples to their expected training distribution can significantly improve performance estimation under covariate shift.

item.title: HyperSparse Neural Networks: Shifting Exploration to Exploitation through Adaptive Regularization
item.description: Sparse neural networks are a key factor in developing resource-efficient machine learning applications.

item.title: FocusFlow: Boosting Key-Points Optical Flow Estimation for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Based on the modeling method, we present FocusFlow, a framework consisting of 1) a mix loss function combined with a classic photometric loss function and our proposed Conditional Point Control Loss (CPCL) function for diverse point-wise supervision; 2) a conditioned controlling model which substitutes the conventional feature encoder by our proposed Condition Control Encoder (CCE).

item.title: Large-kernel Attention for Efficient and Robust Brain Lesion Segmentation
item.description: Vision transformers are effective deep learning models for vision tasks, including medical image segmentation.

item.title: AdvCLIP: Downstream-agnostic Adversarial Examples in Multimodal Contrastive Learning
item.description: In this work, we propose AdvCLIP, the first attack framework for generating downstream-agnostic adversarial examples based on cross-modal pre-trained encoders.

item.title: UniWorld: Autonomous Driving Pre-training via World Models
item.description: In this paper, we draw inspiration from Alberto Elfes' pioneering work in 1989, where he introduced the concept of the occupancy grid as World Models for robots.

item.title: OpenGCD: Assisting Open World Recognition with Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: To bridge this gap, we propose OpenGCD that combines three key ideas to solve the above problems sequentially: (a) We score the origin of instances (unknown or specifically known) based on the uncertainty of the classifier's prediction; (b) For the first time, we introduce generalized category discovery (GCD) techniques in OWR to assist humans in grouping unlabeled data; (c) For the smooth execution of IL and GCD, we retain an equal number of informative exemplars for each class with diversity as the goal.

item.title: CBA: Improving Online Continual Learning via Continual Bias Adaptor
item.description: Online continual learning (CL) aims to learn new knowledge and consolidate previously learned knowledge from non-stationary data streams.

item.title: AudioFormer: Audio Transformer learns audio feature representations from discrete acoustic codes
item.description: This method enables the learning of joint representations among multiple discrete acoustic codes within the same audio input.

item.title: Radiomics-Informed Deep Learning for Classification of Atrial Fibrillation Sub-Types from Left-Atrium CT Volumes
item.description: Furthermore, we ensure complementary information is learned by deep and radiomic features by designing a novel feature de-correlation loss.

item.title: Jurassic World Remake: Bringing Ancient Fossils Back to Life via Zero-Shot Long Image-to-Image Translation
item.description: In this work, we use text-guided latent diffusion models for zero-shot image-to-image translation (I2I) across large domain gaps (longI2I), where large amounts of new visual features and new geometry need to be generated to enter the target domain.

item.title: Exploring Lightweight Hierarchical Vision Transformers for Efficient Visual Tracking
item.description: The Bridge Module incorporates the high-level information of deep features into the shallow large-resolution features.

item.title: OctoPack: Instruction Tuning Code Large Language Models
item.description: We benchmark CommitPack against other natural and synthetic code instructions (xP3x, Self-Instruct, OASST) on the 16B parameter StarCoder model, and achieve state-of-the-art performance among models not trained on OpenAI outputs, on the HumanEval Python benchmark (46. 2% pass@1).

item.title: Explaining Black-Box Models through Counterfactuals
item.description: We present CounterfactualExplanations. jl: a package for generating Counterfactual Explanations (CE) and Algorithmic Recourse (AR) for black-box models in Julia.

item.title: CTP: Towards Vision-Language Continual Pretraining via Compatible Momentum Contrast and Topology Preservation
item.description: Regarding the growing nature of real-world data, such an offline training paradigm on ever-expanding data is unsustainable, because models lack the continual learning ability to accumulate knowledge constantly.

item.title: gSASRec: Reducing Overconfidence in Sequential Recommendation Trained with Negative Sampling
item.description: A large catalogue size is one of the central challenges in training recommendation models: a large number of items makes them memory and computationally inefficient to compute scores for all items during training, forcing these models to deploy negative sampling.

item.title: Neural radiance fields in the industrial and robotics domain: applications, research opportunities and use cases
item.description: We also present a series of proof-of-concept experiments that demonstrate the potential of NeRFs in the industrial domain.

item.title: Robustness Stress Testing in Medical Image Classification
item.description: We conclude that progressive stress testing is a viable and important tool and should become standard practice in the clinical validation of image-based disease detection models.

item.title: Large Language Models for Information Retrieval: A Survey
item.description: This evolution requires a combination of both traditional methods (such as term-based sparse retrieval methods with rapid response) and modern neural architectures (such as language models with powerful language understanding capacity).

item.title: #InsTag: Instruction Tagging for Diversity and Complexity Analysis
item.description: Based on this observation, we propose a data selector based on InsTag to select 6K diverse and complex samples from open-source datasets and fine-tune models on InsTag-selected data.

item.title: Robustified ANNs Reveal Wormholes Between Human Category Percepts
item.description: Because human category reports (aka human percepts) are thought to be insensitive to those same small-norm perturbations -- and locally stable in general -- this argues that ANNs are incomplete scientific models of human visual perception.

item.title: Generative Interpretation
item.description: We introduce generative interpretation, a new approach to estimating contractual meaning using large language models.

item.title: Hierarchy Flow For High-Fidelity Image-to-Image Translation
item.description: In this work, we propose Hierarchy Flow, a novel flow-based model to achieve better content preservation during translation.

item.title: ChatEval: Towards Better LLM-based Evaluators through Multi-Agent Debate
item.description: Text evaluation has historically posed significant challenges, often demanding substantial labor and time cost.

item.title: Effect of Choosing Loss Function when Using T-batching for Representation Learning on Dynamic Networks
item.description: These findings underscore the efficacy of the proposed loss functions in dynamic network modeling.

item.title: Neural Networks for Programming Quantum Annealers
item.description: We explore a setup for performing classification on labeled classical datasets, consisting of a classical neural network connected to a quantum annealer.

item.title: Reinforcement Graph Clustering with Unknown Cluster Number
item.description: To enable the deep graph clustering algorithms to work without the guidance of the predefined cluster number, we propose a new deep graph clustering method termed Reinforcement Graph Clustering (RGC).

item.title: Weighted Sparse Partial Least Squares for Joint Sample and Feature Selection
item.description: However, sPLS extracts the combinations between two data sets with all data samples so that it cannot detect latent subsets of samples.

item.title: Learning on Graphs with Out-of-Distribution Nodes
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are state-of-the-art models for performing prediction tasks on graphs.

item.title: When Monte-Carlo Dropout Meets Multi-Exit: Optimizing Bayesian Neural Networks on FPGA
item.description: Bayesian Neural Networks (BayesNNs) have demonstrated their capability of providing calibrated prediction for safety-critical applications such as medical imaging and autonomous driving.

item.title: Generating observation guided ensembles for data assimilation with denoising diffusion probabilistic model
item.description: This paper presents an ensemble data assimilation method using the pseudo ensembles generated by denoising diffusion probabilistic model.

item.title: SAILOR: Structural Augmentation Based Tail Node Representation Learning
item.description: In the pursuit of promoting the expressiveness of GNNs for tail nodes, we explore how the deficiency of structural information deteriorates the performance of tail nodes and propose a general Structural Augmentation based taIL nOde Representation learning framework, dubbed as SAILOR, which can jointly learn to augment the graph structure and extract more informative representations for tail nodes.

item.title: Shrinking Class Space for Enhanced Certainty in Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: To mitigate potentially incorrect pseudo labels, recent frameworks mostly set a fixed confidence threshold to discard uncertain samples.

item.title: SimMatchV2: Semi-Supervised Learning with Graph Consistency
item.description: Semi-Supervised image classification is one of the most fundamental problem in computer vision, which significantly reduces the need for human labor.

item.title: Manifold DivideMix: A Semi-Supervised Contrastive Learning Framework for Severe Label Noise
item.description: However, their performance degrades when training data contains noisy labels, leading to poor generalization on the test set.

item.title: Optimizing Brain Tumor Classification: A Comprehensive Study on Transfer Learning and Imbalance Handling in Deep Learning Models
item.description: By leveraging a publicly available Brain MRI dataset, the experiment evaluated various transfer learning models for classifying different tumor types, including meningioma, glioma, and pituitary tumors.

item.title: A Survey on Deep Neural Network Pruning-Taxonomy, Comparison, Analysis, and Recommendations
item.description: Modern deep neural networks, particularly recent large language models, come with massive model sizes that require significant computational and storage resources.
